title: Funerary honours for Aulus Mevius Zethus
support: A marble slab, rectangular in form with a moulded surround (dimensions not recorded). The slab is broken on the right side.

layout.p: Two lines of Latin text filling the available field. The second line is slightly indented (and so centred?).

handNote.lettering: Neatly engraved and well proportioned letters with modest serifs. M has hastae slightly off vertical; E has bars of equal length; Z has long and curving horizontal strokes; the third T in line 2 is extended above the line. Words are separated by comma-like triangular interpuncts which find frequent parallels in the inscriptions of Halaesa.

date._: 2nd century CE, if Manganaro's link with  is accepted.

provenanceFound._: Excavated before 1965 from a Roman villa in the vicinity of Halaesa, in contrada Lancinè

provenanceObserved._: Uncertain; image from phot. arch. of soprint., no.3269-B
